FunctionMemberAttributes * functionMemberAttributes
 Specifies if member function is virtual, friend, const or inline.
std::vector
< FormalParameterDefinition * > * 		formalParameters
 List of function parameters. FormalParameters are type of FormalParameterDEFINITION, because in C++ or Java, could be written "void foo(int a = 0) { ... }" to set default parameter value.
FunctionScope * opensScope
 Function scope = list of declared variables inside the function (including formal parameters).
Statement * body
 Body of function.

Detailed Description

Subprogram definitions.

C++

  • example: 
    int foo(int bar1, char bar2)    // this->functionMemberAttributes = NULL (because function is not member of any class), this->formalParameters = { "int bar1", "char bar2" }
{   // -> start of this->body
    int x = 3;
    return x + bar1 * bar2;
}   // -> end of this->body

this->opensScope = { "int bar1", "char bar2", "int x" }

See also:
Definition

Member Data Documentation

FunctionMemberAttributes* FunctionDefinition::functionMemberAttributes

Specifies if member function is virtual, friend, const or inline.

See also:
FunctionMemberAttributes

std::vector<FormalParameterDefinition *>* FunctionDefinition::formalParameters

List of function parameters. FormalParameters are type of FormalParameterDEFINITION, because in C++ or Java, could be written "void foo(int a = 0) { ... }" to set default parameter value.

See also:
FormalParameterDefinition

FunctionScope* FunctionDefinition::opensScope

Function scope = list of declared variables inside the function (including formal parameters).

See also:
FunctionScope

Statement* FunctionDefinition::body

Body of function.

See also:
Statement
